subject: p15393401
History: -year-old with left fifth toe pain and cellulitis, going for angiogram, preop study. Comparison to prior study of at 5:13. PA and lateral views of the chest at 15:20 are submitted.
Impression: The heart remains enlarged and there is unfolding and prominence to the aorta. There are subtle patchy opacities at both lung bases which may represent atelectasis in the setting of somewhat diminished lung volumes, although an early pneumonia cannot be entirely excluded. No pleural effusions. No pneumothorax. No evidence of pulmonary edema. Calcification at the aortic knob consistent with atherosclerosis.
